ygData.msgSnippet: The gentleman has uncovered that building the dist target doesn t work if have to go via a proxy; thats why we re messing in build config.  The dist target

The gentleman has uncovered that building the 'dist' target doesn't work 
if have to go via a proxy; thats why we're messing in build config.  The 
'dist' target -- the one that builds the src and bin  packages -- runs 
the production of the user and development manuals from docbook source.  
The production want to go to the open net to get DTDs and stylesheets.  
Build probably shouldn't have a net dependency; at least a build that is 
expected to run out in the wilds.
St.Ack

Tom Emerson wrote:

>Is there any reason your not using the 'jar' target for Maven instead
>of mucking around trying to hack the build configuration to not build
>anything else?
>
>  
>
